intro: Lithospermum detonsum, commonly known as red root, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its reddish-orange roots, which contain valuable compounds such as lithospermic acid. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, pale purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Lithospermum detonsum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
